data.title: 2011 Abstracts
data.meta_description:
2011 Abstracts - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This document contains abstracts for four papers being presented at the 40th Annual Conference on South Asia in 2011. 

The first paper examines how middle class identity is constructed in India's IT sector and explores exclusionary practices despite assertions of "merit-based" employment. 

The second paper explores the struggles of urban street vendors in Kolkata amid India's economic liberalization and the processes through which the language of "right to the city" is co-opted by the state.  

The third paper reexamines the influential poet Kabir and argues he had more cultural impact than assumed and was not marginalized until later with the advent of colonial modernity.

The fourth paper focuses on representations
